sections.purpose: To visualize live, unstained microorganisms by reflecting light off the specimen against a dark background.
sections.scope: Applicable to specialized microscopic analysis in Microbiology.
procedure: Set up the microscope on a stable surface and power ON.
Install the dark-field condenser and center it properly.
Place the slide on the stage and ensure it is clean.
Focus the specimen using a low-power objective first.
Adjust the condenser height to achieve a completely dark field with a bright specimen.
Switch to higher power objectives if necessary.
After observation, remove the slide and clean the lenses.
Turn OFF the light and store the instrument properly.
Replace the dark-field condenser with a bright-field one if needed for other work.
precautions: The specimen and slide must be extremely clean; dust scatter light.
Avoid using very thick slides or specimens.
The light source must be very bright for effective dark-field visualization.
Handle the specialized condenser with care.
Do not use coarse focus with high-power objectives.
